abstract: Judge Phyllis Randolph Frye of Houston, who came out as transgender in 1976, has for decades been on vanguard of transgender civil rights movement; Frye is enthusiastic about rising mainstream awareness of nation's transgender community, but is well-versed in history of movement, emphasizing that gender identity issues did not suddenly materialize with the very public transition of Caitlyn Jenner.
lead_paragraph: Decades before Caitlyn Jenner, Phyllis Frye was grappling with bias, scorn and personal pain, and helping the transgender movement take shape.

headline.main: Once a Pariah, Now a Judge: The Early Transgender Journey of Phyllis Frye
headline.print_headline: Once a Pariah, Now a Transgender Judge

snippet: Decades before Caitlyn Jenner, Phyllis Frye was grappling with bias, scorn and personal pain, and helping the transgender movement take shape.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
